column5: To fire up Ol' Nellie:    for some pork spares, & boneless beef short ribs.
oh man that looks so good....  *insert drool icon here*
i forgot to ask in my state of meat shock, how hot and how long?
YUMMMMMMERS  Ribfest is here this weekend and for 20 bucks a rack,I,ll be making my own thank you very much.
Man if your gonna keep postin pics like that---I'm gonna take my football and go home

The old adage "They're done,when they're done" applies here. Different cookers cook differently. ( my old horizontal cooks with gentle smoke & takes a little longer than say a drum smoker).  The outside temp. makes a difference, too, as does wind.  But these went 5 hours at 250-275`  .........  My drum smokers do it all in 4 hrs. with a smokier flavor..
All right, we need an OFC rib cook off!  OK, You win, what time do we eat?  (and I thought my " Cliffie's caveman ribs" were good! Those look much better!)
talk about cruel and unusual punishment!
thanks for making my Subway look like crap!
thanks for the pic's and temp info.  now I can tinker too...
But think of the wieght you just lost,

Yum  Start  Dry rub of my own.On it goes,indirect heat 275 for 3 hours.    Getting there,splash of sauce    Quick grill on the meat side. Gives the sauce abit of a crisp.    Meat peeled off in your mouth .
Oh man that looks so good....

Dang you should send the pics to one resturant I went to out west here they ribs they ahd were dry burnt and poopy looking I was glad they were not mine. I think i know what i need to make when i get home.
